headline: Bumble Cuts 30% of Staff as Online Dating Hits ‘Inflection Point’
summary: Dating-app executives are realizing that wooing younger users turned off by online swiping takes fewer workers.

raw.headline: Bumble Cuts 30% of Staff as Online Dating Hits ‘Inflection Point’
raw.summary: Dating-app executives are realizing that wooing younger users turned off by online swiping takes fewer workers.

headline: Online Dating Is On the Outs. This App Is Breaking Up With 30% of Its Workforce.
summary: The online-dating platform  Bumble  is laying off roughly 30% of its workforce as part of an effort to arrest a yearslong decline, the company announced in a Securities and Exchange Commission filing Wednesday.  Bumble also raised its revenue outlook for its fiscal second quarter.  Online-dating companies  Match Group  and Bumble have experienced plenty of heartache since going public in 2020 and 2021, respectively, with both struggling to attract and retain users and deliver returns for shareholders.
